intro: Hieracium bulbisetum, commonly known as the bulbous hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are yellow and borne in clusters. The plant is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
